alert.note: Alert for Fleming (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 01 at 2:45AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Bath, southeastern Fleming, Rowan and Elliott Counties through 345 AM EDT... At 244 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Grange City, or 8 miles northeast of Owingsville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sharkey, Ramey, Farmers and Plummers Landing around 250 AM EDT. Hilda, Bluestone and Freestone around 255 AM EDT. Morehead, Munson, Rodburn, Hays Crossing, Clearfield, Cranston, Brandy and Waltz around 300 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Christy, Gates, Crix, Triplett, Pelfrey, Vale, Haldeman, Wagner, Hamm, Elliottville, Farley, Wagner Store, Fannin Valley, Minor, Lytten, Sandy Hook, Stark, Newfoundland and Bruin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
